intro: Buena carua, commonly known as the mountain beauty, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and fuzzy, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
